name: desktop-normalize
description: CSS base styles for HTML5 desktop applications
readme:
Desktop Normalize
=================

> CSS base styles for HTML5 desktop applications

[![npm version](https://badge.fury.io/js/desktop-normalize.svg)](http://badge.fury.io/js/desktop-normalize)

The purpose of this module is to provide a set of base styles to make HTML5 web applications get a more native look 'n feel when building desktop applications with shell technologies like [Electron](http://electron.atom.io).

Installing
----------

Run the following command to install `desktop-normalize`:

```sh
npm install --save desktop-normalize
```

You can then find the `css` file in `node_modules/desktop-normalize/desktop-normalize.css`.

Support
-------

If you're having any problem, please [raise an issue](https://github.com/jviotti/desktop-normalize/issues/new) on GitHub and I'll be happy to help.

Contribute
----------

- Issue Tracker: [github.com/jviotti/desktop-normalize/issues](https://github.com/jviotti/desktop-normalize/issues)
- Source Code: [github.com/jviotti/desktop-normalize](https://github.com/jviotti/desktop-normalize)
